abstract.p: Jeffrey Abelson letter replies to David Hackett Fischer's July 1 Op-Ed article criticizing historicity of the movie The Patriot

block.p: I'm impressed with David Hackett Fischer's critique of the movie ''The Patriot'' (Op-Ed, July 1), but as a teacher of history he knows that popular pedagogy dictates that there is no truth except what we want to believe. Just as today's activism depends on falsity to ''raise awareness,'' Hollywood depends on drama, whether true to a ''perceived'' history or not, to raise dollars.

If our children were taught history instead of demagogy and if they read more than they watched TV, historical inaccuracy in a piece of $9 entertainment would be mere distortion by another storyteller.
